titleStmt.title: A. Williams et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10029

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his eclency the Govnor of the Commonwealth of Ky

We your undersigned petitioners must ^Respectfully^ Represent to your Honor that on the Election day for President and vice President of the United States in the Town of Wyoming Bath County Ky Came Jas Goodpaster and others fell upon One J L Jones fo Sd County And unnessecarily Beat and Brused him and the James Not being in the fault and made no defece until attacked By Goodpaster and others and James was taken up by the ^^officer^ of Said Town and brought before A Jury of his country and the Jury without Knowing the facts in the case fined sd James 9.00 With cost of Suit now We your petitioners pray your honor that you may Remit the same

A Williams
J W Foudray
James Johnson
John M roberts
A Lither
Akin Williams
Bford Goodpaster
William Jones
William Evanmattan
R. A. Caldwell
S. C. Atchison
John Estill
Isac Atchison
Joseph Arnel
A. Bowlings

Bath J. P.
$9 } Breach
D L Jones
Remission Issd
Feby 15. 1861
Hon L W Andrews
Frankfort
Ky
